adjective.description: Working or produced by machines or machinery.
(of a person or action) not having or showing thought or spontaneity; automatic.
examples: she stopped the mechanical brushing of her hair

adjective.description: Relating to physical forces or motion; physical.
examples: the smoothness was the result of mechanical abrasion

noun.description: The working parts of a machine, especially a car.
(especially with allusion to Shakespeare's A Midsummer Night's Dream) a manual worker.
A completed assembly of artwork and copy, typically mounted on a sheet of stiff paper.

origin: Late Middle English (describing an art or occupation concerned with the construction of machines): via Latin from Greek mēkhanikos (see mechanic) + -al.
